summary:
Ancient Egypt was an ancient civilization in Northeast Africa, mainly along the Nile River. It began around 3100 BC when Upper and Lower Egypt united. The civilization had three main kingdoms: Old, Middle, and New. During the New Kingdom, Egypt was very powerful, ruling parts of Nubia and the Levant.

Egyptians were skilled in many areas. They developed writing, built impressive structures like pyramids, and had advanced agriculture and trade. They also created a strong government with a pharaoh as leader. Ancient Egypt's legacy includes amazing art, architecture, and inventions that still fascinate people today.
title: Ancient Egypt
